[[Image:fightposter.jpg|200px|right|thumb|The fight poster from the set of ''Rocky Balboa'' promotes the boxing match between Rocky Balboa and Mason "The Line" Dixon.]]
 
'''Mason "The Line" Dixon''' (born [[November 21]], [[1982]]), played by real-life boxer [[Antonio Tarver]], is the primary opponent of fictional boxer [[Rocky Balboa (character)|Rocky Balboa]] in the [[2006]] motion picture ''[[Rocky Balboa (film)|Rocky Balboa]]''. His nickname references the historic [[Mason-Dixon line]]. Dixon bears a resemblance to real-life boxer [[Mike Tyson]] due to his ability to knock people out early.
'''Mason "The Line" Dixon''' (born [[November 21]], [[1982]]), played by real-life boxer [[Antonio Tarver]], is the primary opponent of fictional boxer [[Rocky Balboa (character)|Rocky Balboa]] in the [[2006]] motion picture ''[[Rocky Balboa (film)|Rocky Balboa]]''. His nickname references the historic [[Mason-Dixon line]]. Dixon bears a resemblance to real-life boxer [[Mike Tyson]] due to his ability to knock people out early.
